result.execSummary:
The defendant David Charles Van Scyoc was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David Charles Van Scyoc is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David Charles Van Scyoc was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Charles Van Scyoc in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Taylor L. Kraus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered count dismissed.

AS TO COUNT 2:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Court sentenced defendant to serve 2 days in the House of Correction with credit for 2 days served FOR A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION. 

Court ordered defendant to pay ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 08-22-2016 or, as a penalty if not paid, convert to a civil judgment.  Court advised the defendant of his appeal rights.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant David Charles Van Scyoc in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case calendared for jury trial.  Parties are ready.  Case passed.

CASE RECALLED.  ADA Joy Hammond now appears for the State.
This court will be proceeding with another jury trial.  No spin courts available.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 21.  Jury trial scheduled for February 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Charles Van Scyoc in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Case was set for jury trial during Branch 24's charging week.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 24.  Jury trial scheduled for December 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Charles Van Scyoc in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  
Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Final pre-trial.  Hearing proceeded.  Defense still in a contest posture.  Case remains set for Jury trial on 8-19-15 at 8:30 a.m. before Branch 24.

Defendant David Charles Van Scyoc in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Deann L Heard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defense requested a final pretrial and jury trial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David Charles Van Scyoc in court with attorney Elizabeth A Carlson.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Court reiterated the no contact order.    Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 24.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Alicia B; Coty B; or their residence
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant David Charles Van Scyoc in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  
Defendant David Charles Van Scyoc in custody.  
Gale G. Shelton appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  
Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
